Type.Name: Authorization

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Authorization extends System.Object

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Supplies authentication messages used to authenticate a client to server.

remarks.para: The class contains authentication information returned by a module. instances are used to pass server challenge responses and client preauthentication information.

para.block: The property indicates whether the authentication, as defined by the authentication protocol implemented by the caller, is finished or requires additional information exchange between the client and server.

Docs.param: A containing the authentication message to be sent to the server.
A containing a unique identifier that will be used to identify the authenticated connection, or .

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class with the specified authorization message, completion status, and connection group identifier.

remarks.para: This constructor creates a instance with the property set to , the property set to , and the property set to . If is or a zero-length string, is set to . If is or a zero-length string, is set to .

block.para:
The connection group identifier is used to restrict access to the server connection established with the current authorization instance. Only
instances that have as their property value can use the connection. The connection group information set by this constructor is also available in the property of the service point that represents the connection.

The property indicates whether the authentication, as defined by the authentication protocol implemented by the caller, is finished or requires additional information exchange between the client and server.

MemberSignature.Value: .property bool Complete { public hidebysig specialname instance bool get_Complete() }

summary.para: Gets a value indicating the completion status of the authentication.

value.para: if the authentication process is complete; otherwise, .

remarks.para: The property is set to when the authentication process between the client and the server is finished.

para.block: Some authentication modules, such as a Kerberos module, use multiple round trips between the client and server to complete an authentication. The authentication module sets the property to until the authentication is complete.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string ConnectionGroupId { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_ConnectionGroupId() }

summary.para: Gets the unique identifier for an authenticated connection.

value.para: A containing a unique connection identifier, or if no value was specified to the constructor for the current instance.

remarks.para: The connection group identifier is used to restrict access to the server connection established with the current authorization instance.

para.block: Only instances that have as their property value can use the connection. If the value of this property is , access to the connection is not restricted in this manner. The connection group information is also available in the property of the service point that represents the connection.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Message { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Message() }

summary.para: Gets the response to an authentication challenge.

value.para: A containing the message that will be returned to the server in response to an authentication challenge.

para.block:
The content of the string returned by this property is determined by the protocol implemented by the
object that created the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .property class System.String[] ProtectionRealm { public hidebysig specialname instance class System.String[] get_ProtectionRealm() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_ProtectionRealm(class System.String[] value) }

summary.para: Gets or sets the URIs that can be authenticated using the value in the property.

para.block: A compares a URI to this list to determine if the current instance can be used to authenticate a request for a given URI.
